meta.title: Warden System Standards
meta.description: Registry of codified best practices and technical constraints.

standards.name: File Structure Consolidation
standards.guidance: Functional artifacts must be grouped into single root-level directories (engine, registry, docs, history, validation). Avoid deeply nested subfolders for core scripts.

standards.name: Authoritative Tool Pathing
standards.guidance: Protocols and bootstrap instructions must use explicit project-relative paths (e.g., node engine/onboard.js) instead of root-level symlinks.

standards.name: Tiered Deliverable Persistence
standards.guidance: Categorize deliverables by utility (Vital, Transitional, Ephemeral) to manage context window efficiency for zero-knowledge systems.

standards.name: Zero-Knowledge Active Enforcement
standards.guidance: Protocols and tools must provide active validation loops (read-back gates, provenance checks, and mandatory status pulses) to guide agents through complex state machines.

standards.name: Canonical Intent Enforcement
standards.guidance: All interactions within a GSD cycle must be mapped to a registered intent pattern. Commands that cannot be resolved must be justified via the Socratic Brake (--justify) before execution.

standards.name: Deterministic Portable Pathing
standards.guidance: All system tools must utilize the 'resolve' utility from path_resolver.js rather than native path.join(__dirname, ...) or relative string literals to ensure portability.

standards.name: Metadata-Driven Governance
standards.guidance: All business logic regarding state transitions, constraints, and gate enforcement must be defined in the Protocol Registry (protocols.json). Execution tools must act as generic interpreters of this metadata, avoiding hard-coded rules.
